bibl.title: Letter from Wyndham B. Blanton to Philip Showalter Hench, May 28, 1941

div1.p: Blanton informs Hench that the annual meeting of the historical section of the Richmond Academy of Medicine is called "Walter Reed Day," not "Walter Reed Memorial Day."

div1.head: Letter from Wyndham B. Blanton to Philip Showalter Hench, May 28, 1941
div1.opener:
DR. WYNDHAM B. BLANTON
828 WEST FRANKLIN STREET
RICHMOND, VIRGINIA
May 28, 1941
Dr. Philip Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
We are much interested in Walter Reed
in Richmond since he is a Virginian. The
annual meeting of our historical section of
the Richmond Academy of Medicine occurs on
a day which has been called Walter Reed Day.
I did not know that there was such a thing
as a Walter Reed Memorial Day other than
the one mentioned above.

Dr. Henry E. Sigerist, Professor of the
History of Medicine at Johns Hopkins Univer-
sity, is in touch with every historical move-
ment in this country, and I am sure he could
at once answer your question.
